meanings.definition: The position or office of an apostle.
meanings.sent1: In the early church, Peter held the apostleship with great honor.
meanings.sent2: The apostleship required traveling far and wide to spread the teachings.
meanings.sent3: When John accidentally took Paul's apostleship badge, there was quite a mix-up.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her community service gave her an apostleship-like role in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The apostleship was a sacred responsibility passed down through generations.

meanings.definition: The work or duties of an apostle.
meanings.sent1: Paul's apostleship involved preaching and establishing new churches.
meanings.sent2: The apostleship included teaching, healing, and guiding the believers.
meanings.sent3: Simon's attempt at baking bread turned into an apostleship of burnt loaves.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership in the project took on an apostleship quality, inspiring others to follow.
meanings.sent5: The apostleship was a challenging but rewarding journey of faith and service.
